ex4D:plugin-description.p: This plugin returns the list of MAC (Media Access Control) addresses of the local computer.
On Mac, SCNetworkConfiguration is used. On Windows, GetAdaptersAddresses is used.

ex4D:command-description.p: Because the Windows API does not distinguish Bluetooth from Ethernet (or even WiFi on XP), the way we determine the primary MAC is somewhat questionable.

ex4D:argument.label: addresses
ex4D:argument.p: The hardware address (Mac) or PhysicalAddress (Windows). The delimiter is a colon on both platforms. (Note: Ipconfig on Windows uses hyphens. Pseudo-addresses following 00-00-00-00-00-00 is ignored on Windows.)

ex4D:argument.label: types
ex4D:argument.p: The type (Mac) or IfType (Windows). For example, Ethernet, IEEE80211, Bluetooth. Note that on Windows XP, WiFi appears as Ethernet. On Vista and later, WiFi appears as IEEE80211.

ex4D:return-value.label: address
ex4D:return-value.p: The hardware address associated with type en0 (Mac) or IfType associated with Ethernet and does not contain the string "Bluetooth" (Windows).
